dataIdInfo.idAbs: This tool takes a scientific name or a list of scientific names as input and returns a list of reference codes (in the form of an SQL statement) associated with that species. Optionally, the tool will create a feature class of all survey sites that contain those species.

tool.name: RefCodeSearch

param.name: sname
param.dialogReference: Single species scientific name or a list of scientific names separated by commas.

param.name: bool_operator
param.displayname: Boolean Operator, necessary if multiple species are listed
param.dialogReference:
Optional parameter to be used if there is more than one species name listed.

  • If the OR operator is chosen, the tool will print a list of reference codes that have ANY of the species associated with it.

  • If the AND operator is chosen, the tool will print a list of reference codes where ALL species are present.

param.name: out_fc
param.dialogReference: If you would like a feature class of survey sites that contain your species, choose the name and location of the feature class here.

tool.summary: This tool takes a scientific name or a list of scientific names as input and returns a list of reference codes (in the form of an SQL statement) associated with that species. Optionally, the tool will create a feature class of all survey sites that contain those species.
tool.usage:
The user must have a local copy of FIND checked out and viewable from within the table of contents.

If there are any selections on the species list table the tool may not work properly.

If the dialogue box closes after the tool runs, you can get back to the printed query by going to the top of ArcMap:

Geoprocessing > Results > Expand Current Session > Expand the Tool > Right click on Messages > View
